actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to increase from $15,000 to $30,000 the maximum amount that may be allowed by the head of a Federal agency in settlement of claims for loss of personal property incident to the service of an individual who is a member of the uniformed services or a civilian employee of the Federal Government.

summary.text: Amends the Military Personnel and Civilian Employee Claims Act of 1964 to increase from $15,000 to $30,000 the maximum amount the Secretary of a military department is authorized to pay to settle a claim for the loss of, or damage to personal property incident to the service of a member of the uniformed services or a civilian employee of such department.

titles.title: A bill to increase from $15,000 to $30,000 the maximum amount that may be allowed by the head of a Federal agency in settlement of claims for loss of personal property incident to the service of an individual who is a member of the uniformed services or a civilian employee of the Federal Government.
